document_title: Knee joint space stenosis: Causes, signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: hep-khe-khop-goi.json_0_What is knee joint space stenosis?
subsection_content:
Knee joint space narrowing is a condition in which the cartilage wears away over time, causing the space inside the joint to become smaller. From there, the movement process becomes difficult, often causing pain and stiffness, even loss of mobility or disability. (first)
Specifically, for a healthy knee joint, there is always enough space between the femur, tibia and patella, ensuring flexible joint movement. However, if severe injury or degeneration occurs, the cartilage surface that covers the ends of the bones will wear away. This is the reason why the knee joint space narrows, causing friction between cartilage tissue to increase during movement, leading to common pain.
subsection_title: hep khe khop goi.json. What is knee joint space stenosis?
subsection_data:
